stimulusHtml:
© The Trustees of the British Museum / Art Resource, NY

The symmetric design and use of vibrantly colored feathers in the ‘ahu ‘ula shown were designed to
choicesHtml: provide camouflage for the ruler on journeys through the rain forest
represent the balance of the elemental forces of life and death
reflect a balance in the relationship between the ruler and the community
highlight materials that embodied the divine power of the ruler
